lead_paragraph: Voting rights advocates charge that local election boards are staging an end run around a federal court ruling by writing rules that discourage African-American voters.

headline.print_headline: New Vote Rules Reignite a Debate in North Carolina
headline.main: Critics Say North Carolina Is Curbing Black Vote. Again.

snippet: Voting rights advocates charge that local election boards are staging an end run around a federal court ruling by writing rules that discourage African-American voters....
abstract: Voting rights advocates accuse some of North Carolina's county election boards of making end run around federal appeals court ruling that overturned much of state's 2013 voting law, which was found to discourage African-Americans from voting; Republicans, who control all 100 election boards, deny accusations and say rules will increase vote from every region and interest group.
